department: Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development
short_summary: Services professionnels en informatique centrés sur les tâches pour la stratégie innovante (SPICT) pour la numérisation des services des applications.Net.
description: The Department of Foreign Affairs Trade and Development Canada (DFATD) has identified a requirement for multiple Programmer Analysts and Application/Software Architects with a Secret clearance to provide support to Business Solutions team in the delivery of Digital Transformation projects for departmental projects and initiatives...
full_summary:
=====================================

### SCOPE OF WORK

The Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development Canada (DFATD) seeks to engage a team of qualified Professionnal Informatique in a CBC-supported context to deliver application development services within the framework of our ongoing Digital Transformation project. This call for proposal is open to holders of a Tier 1 TBIPS SA in the National Capital Region, with expertise in the categories of Programmer Analyst Level 3 and Application/Software Architect Level 3.

### PROJECT OVERVIEW

The Business Solutions division of DFATD requires the services of experienced Programmers and Application Architects to support DFSI’s Business Solutions Team with the delivery of multiple Digital transformation projects. The project involves supporting clients in the development of a clear understanding of their roadmap and establishment of a technology strategy. The intention is to empower DFSI and clients by de-centralizing the planning, delivery, operation, and measurement of technology-enabled business solutions.

### KEY REQUIREMENTS

*   Interim Resource Pool of approximately 1,480 days of services, to a maximum of seven (7) resources under Tier 1, Path A.
*   Contract duration expected to be one (1) year following contract signature, with two (2) possible option years.
*   Compliant with Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA), Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP) and World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO AGP)
*   Mandatory requirement under the act implies no exclusion policies


### EVALUATION CRITERIA

Bidders will be evaluated based on a combination of Technical Merit and Price. A Short-list of suppliers will be identified based on a discreet evaluation, based upon individual supplier evaluation methodology.

### BACKGROUND AND CONTACT

For information on DFATD and any other business opportunities available, DFATD encourages potential proposers to submit an expression of interest. Contact: Betty Woodman Phone: (343) 203-6922, Email:  betty.woodman@international.gc.ca

*   The enquiries and RFP documents will be e-mailed directly from the Contracting Authority named above to the qualified supplier who is invited to bid on this requirement.

Note: Task-Based Informatics Professional Services (TBIPS) method of supply is refreshed three (3) years per year to ensure a diverse and up to date pool of suppliers registered and certified under the TBIPS supply arrangement.
